intro: Cabrera, commonly known as the Cabrera plant, is a species native to certain regions of South America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and large, heart-shaped leaves. It produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of red, yellow, and orange. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
